Posts.Content: This is not meant to scare anyone it's just a reminder to check your boobies even if you've had a reconstruction. Know your bodies ladies and gents. My story:  In 2003 was 1st diagnosed with BC at 33 yrs old after finding a small lump. Turned out to be 3 tumours including a DCIS and considered Grade 2 with a spread to my lymph nodes. On 14th Feb 2003 I had a mastectomy with a diep tramflap reconstruction followed by chemo, zoladex, radiotherapy, and tamoxifen. In 2014 I found a tiny lump in my breast reconstruction which we all thought was going to be scar tissue but nope the BC was back. Thankfully it was tiny and was dealt with via a WLE and being put back on Tamoxifen. On 29th December 2017 I was given the shock news my BC is back. Again we thought it was scar tissue.  This time there's 3 tumours just to the left of my reconstruction pocket.  CT and MRI scans show I also have Secondary BC in a chest lymph node and in my right lung, albeit small. On 19th Feb I will be starting 6 cycles of chemo via docetaxel intravenous  and capecitabine tablets with a view to making it all go away. Fingers crossed it works
Posts.Title: Check your boobies even after a mastectomy. Recurrences do happen

Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief No this is my first time with this regime and I have been told it should be more gentle than the last time. It's also less cycles. I will definitely check out the chemo threads.  Thank you T
Posts.Title: Check your boobies even after a mastectomy. Recurrences do happen
Check your boobies even after a mastectomy. Recurrences do happen

Posts.Content: Thanks Karen Can't believe how much my head and mind feel all already. My hair and head isn't itching like it was and I didn't wake up to find my bed looking like I had shared it with a moulting dog Teresa X
Posts.Title: ***March 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club***

Posts.Content: Hi all Due to have my 2nd round of Docetaxel and Capecitibane on Monday subject to bloods and what Oncologist says due to the reaction I had last.time.  After a good positve day yesterday I came down with a bump. Woke to find my bed covered in hair and everytime I tried to style my hair more just fell out. This evening I decided to take back control so I got the clippers out and shaved it off.
Posts.Title: ***March 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club***
